channel.title: Images in Java Applets
channel.description:
Is there a better way to use images in Applets rather than [code]back = getImage (getCodeBase (), "Land.jpeg"); [/code]
I've seen [code]Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("URL");[/code] but netither of these seem to work for me when I paint the applet.
BTW to paint I use: [code]g.drawImage (back, 0, 0, this);[/code]
Am I just coding wrong, because when I preview in Netbeans, it comes up with a blank screen.

item.title: Images in Java Applets
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

perhaps you should wait a bit
images in java are a little bit odd if you’re new to them,
when you call the getImage(), it returns immediatly, even though the image is not loaded completely, when more of the image becomes avaliable, the methods in the ImageProducer interface are invoked,
a similar story when you draw an image, the method drawImage() returns immediatly, and when more of the image becomes avaliable, the methods in ImageConsumer get invoked.

when you pass ‘this’ to drawImage(), thats an instance of ImageConsumer

I might have gotten a few details wrong, but that basic idea is correct.
it looks to me like you’re doing everything right, I just suggest you wait a little bit, to give the image a chance to load a little.
or comment out the drawing of an Oval and try, but i dont think thats causing anything bad
also, check if some of the image loading methods return null.

Read full topic

item.title: Images in Java Applets
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“d_sign, post:3, topic:170896”]Sure thing

[code]/*Dawn Of Aura */

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.awt.;
import java.io.;
import java.net.*;
import java.awt.Graphics;

public class dawnofaura extends Applet{
Image back;

public void init(){
    back = getImage (getCodeBase (), "Land.jpeg"); 
    setBackground(Color.BLACK);
}

public void paint(Graphics g){
    g.drawImage (back, 0, 0, this);
    g.setColor(Color.WHITE);
    g.fillOval(33,56,100,100);
}

}
[/code]

I’m just trying something out with images…[/quote]
A little off topic, what’s "Dawn Of Aura?.

Read full topic

item.title: Images in Java Applets
item.dc:creator: @d_sign d_sign
item.description:
@d_sign wrote:

Sure thing

[code]/*Dawn Of Aura */

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.awt.;
import java.io.;
import java.net.*;
import java.awt.Graphics;

public class dawnofaura extends Applet{
Image back;

public void init(){
    back = getImage (getCodeBase (), "Land.jpeg"); 
    setBackground(Color.BLACK);
}

public void paint(Graphics g){
    g.drawImage (back, 0, 0, this);
    g.setColor(Color.WHITE);
    g.fillOval(33,56,100,100);
}

}
[/code]

I’m just trying something out with images…
